The National Museum, New Delhi, began with a blueprint prepared by the Maurice Gwyer Committee in May 1946. It houses over 200,000 objects, covering a time span of over five thousand years of Indian cultural heritage.

patterns: I want to book a ticket
responses: To book tickets for the National Museum, you can pre-book online via our official website or contact us directly. Pre-booking is required for school visits and can be done by emailing yuvasaathi.nm@gmail.com at least 7 days in advance.

patterns: Can I buy snacks at the museum?
responses: The National Museum offers a variety of snacks that can be pre-booked along with your visit. Available snacks include Sandwiches (Veg/Non-Veg), Samosas, Fresh Fruit Juice, Biscuits and Cookies, and Tea and Coffee.

patterns: Tell me about the Yuva Saathi Programme
What is the Yuva Saathi Programme?
responses: The Yuva Saathi Programme offers free guided tours for school students, running on all working days. Tours must be pre-booked at least 7 days in advance and are available in morning and afternoon slots. Teachers or escorts need to pay a nominal fee of Rs. 20 per person.

patterns: Tell me about the Volunteer Guide Programme
responses: The Path Pradarshak Volunteer Guide Programme provides free 90-minute tours showcasing highlights of the museum. Available on weekdays and weekends, these tours are led by trained volunteers and cover around 30 notable objects and galleries.

patterns: How do I get to the museum?
responses: The National Museum is located at Janpath, New Delhi - 110011. It is easily accessible via the Central Secretariat and Udyog Bhawan metro stations. Nearby bus stops include National Museum and Nirman Bhawan with routes 505, 521, 522, and others servicing the area.

patterns: What time does the museum close?
responses: The National Museum is open Tuesday to Sunday from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM, and it is closed on Mondays and National Holidays.

The National Museum offers ticket booking options for various categories: Adults: Rs. 20 per person, Kids (up to class 12): Free with a valid school ID, Foreign Nationals: Rs. 650 (including an audio guide).

Phone number of the National Museum
